Description: Cypriot terracotta figure fragment of man with horse. The man is solid and probably mould-made, added to the left side of hollow hand-made (?) horse. The man's left hand holding the horses bridle was added last. The man is only wearing a pleated skirt. The head and legs of the man are missing, only part of chest, left leg and neck of the horse remain. Pale buff fabric with orange core. Rare fine mica and abundant white and black stone inclusions up to 3mm across.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

A similar Cypriot horse with man figure has been found in Amathus tomb 83, now in the British Museum and dated to the Cypro-Archaic II period (600BC-500BC). This is an uncommon type (Hermary 1996, pl. 4.6; Tatton-Brown 1982, 179, note 27; Crouwel & Tatton-Brown 1989, 110 and pl. 22,2; Karageorghis 1995, no.II(ii)1, pl.50.8, Amathus tomb 83; BM GR 1894,1101.191). Boston example 86.487, which may be from a similar composition.
